The only data i need from the competitor site, is price."

title: Scrape Property Website for Data and Build Dashboard
jobs_text:
"I would like to scrape a property website for all data including picture, price, address, number of rooms and all data in between. 
 
This data needs to be extracted to a CSV file as well as a database of your choosing. 
 
Once data is collected, I would like to see the data visualised in a dashboard.  
 
Bonus(not necessary), if we can set up a pipeline so that data can be scraped and pulled every week. The dashboard will be automatically updated every week. 
 
This has to be done in Python, and dashboarding tool of your choice."

title: Web scraper required for Canadian real estate
jobs_text:
"We are looking to generate leads on the Canadian real estate market. As part of the lead generation process, we are looking to scrape recent sales data from a website. Information that we will require will include, but is not limited to:  
 
- Address 
- Most recent transaction date 
- Transaction sales price 
- Current estimated home value 
 
For this specific site, the complexities include: 
 
- You need to be logged in to the site 
- You need to navigate to the page by inputting the address 
- You need to capture data from specific sections on the site 
 
We are looking for someone who has worked with and/or created various web scraping tools to generate this data, and are familiar with processes for deduplicating and cleansing lead lists."

title: Data Scraping Tool for my MLS Services- Real Estate
jobs_text: "I'm looking for a simple spreadsheet build that can scrape data from my MLS service providers at the push of a button. I need a system built that will log into all markets, pull the listings into excel, based on equity available. It will find the listing price of a new listing and pull in Zillow Data, Redfin Data, and Realtor.com data and average those to create an estimated home value. Then I can have the daily listings specific to my business model compared to the average ARV (after repair value) I'm trying to get the new listings bubbled up to the top so that we don‚Äôt have to do it manually and i'll be able to pick the top 10-20 listings in each market that are listed daily. This is for my home flipping business. I'm looking for the cheaper distressed homes and list price VS the average of the big 3 sites named above could be a great indicator of a great equity position. This may be able to be done without using my MLS and just using Zillow in each city for newly listed properties. I‚Äôm not great with this kind of stuff so looking to bounce ideas off of someone that well versed in this type of work. I work in DFW, Houston, Waco, and Birmingham, AL. Thanks!"

title: Data collection & annotation of real estate images
jobs_text:
"We are building a deep learning-based system for enhancing the sky in outdoor real estate images. We already have a a baseline system and are looking to build a test dataset on which we can evaluate our system on. 
 
Our baseline system makes errors on some edge cases & we are looking to specifically collect images containing these edge cases. Some of these cases include when the images contain small branches or white roof or posts/antenna/fences. 
 
Initially we are looking for 100 images + data annotation. Later on, want to increase this to several thousand depending on how well the first phase goes in terms of how easy/fast/cheap it is to collect these images."

I need you to find the URL associated with each of these product numbers on the store's website and extract the product characteristics. from each webpage There will be approximately 50 characteristics needing extraction.  
 
The final product should be an Excel (or CSV) file containing, for each item number, the product name and all of the product characteristics. 
 
This should be a relatively simple task for an experienced web scraper."

title: Help us build web scrapers
jobs_text:
"üëã Hi Freelancers, 
 
We have an exciting problem: scraping 5,000 - 7,000 rental agent websites in the Netherlands. 
 
To do this we've built a tool that allows you to rapidly create web scrapers. The tool is a Google Chrome Extension that you can install in your browser. Then, using a JSON configuration file you can rapidly build web scrapers. 
 
We're looking for people who are able to use this tool to build web scrapers for these rental agent websites. Preferably we would like to work long-term with someone, as getting to know the ins and outs of the tool might take a bit of work. 
 
As a try-out, we want to start with 5 hours of work, and if we're happy with the quality we can make a longer arrangement. 
 
Each rental agent website is slightly different, so we're looking for someone who is able to be creative and find solutions for each rental agent website. Being able to work precisely is a requirement as the data needs to be scraped exactly as it is stated on the website. 
 
Knowledge of the Dutch language is NOT required as our tool works great with Google Translate. 
 
Skills required: 
 - JSON 
 - HTML and CSS selectors. 
 - Regex (regular expressions). 
 
To get a better idea of how the tool works. 
You can find the documentation + video of our tool here: 
"

title: I need a Web Crawler for Real Estate Websites
jobs_text:
"I need a crawler for the ImmobilienScout24, Homegate, Newhome website (all Swiss real estate platforms: 
Requirements: 
- The crawler should have the function that advertisements from private customers (no brokers) are displayed. 
We only want addresses from private customers including phone numbers. 
- Crawler should display the data as an Excel list after downloading. 
- No API may be used 
- The crawler must crawl all pages 
- All pages must be crawled at least twice a day (hourly would be ideal) 
- The complete crawler must be handed over to us. The operation of the crawler is carried out by us 
Important: The crawler must work independently of the platform. The platforms ([login to view URL], Homegate, [login to view URL]) should not be able to ban the crawler (e.g. via the IP, captcha). If this is not technically feasible, please do not submit an offer. You will have to give a guarantee for the unrestricted functionality. Details can be discussed and clarified by message. 
If you submit an offer, I need the following information from you: 
‚Ä¢ Your references. 
‚Ä¢ Which programming language would you like to use? 
‚Ä¢ How long does it take you to program? 
‚Ä¢ A fixed price, offers with hourly rates will not be considered. 
‚Ä¢ Confirmation that you can give a guarantee for the above-mentioned functionality 
I will be glad to answer any questions you might have. Thank you very much!"

title: Real Estate Data Specialist
jobs_text:
"Need to Hire 3 Freelancers  
 
Looking to bring on a hungry and detailed oriented Data specialist who can provide 5-6/hrs a day. This team member must be willing to learn and pay attention to detail.  
 
Training and coaching will be provided by company. If all goes well, our goal is to make this a full-time opportunity with the ability to be promoted.

‚Ä¢	9am-1pm EST 
‚Ä¢	3pm- 7pm EST 
 
Duties: 
‚Ä¢	Managing Data wit dialers (Call tools, Air call) 
‚Ä¢	Ability to navigate a CRM 
‚Ä¢	Data Entry  
‚Ä¢	Basic Sales Skills (Objection Handling) 
 
Skilled Required: 
‚Ä¢	Minimum of 1+ years of experience with customer service or cold calling (Inbound or Outbound) 
‚Ä¢	WPM of 45 or higher (Typing test will be given) 
‚Ä¢	Fluent in English. Both oral and written 
 
Bonus Skills: 
 
Real Estate Experience 
Data Management Experience 
Data Entry Experience  
 
Must include a 1‚Äì3-minute introduction audio file when you apply. In Introduction, please talk about why you are the best fit for this position and What your favorite color is. If you miss this step, you will be declined.  
"

title: Develop scrappers to scrape real estate websites
jobs_text:
"We are looking to build an automated process that is able to scrape property listings from various portals. 
We are interested to aggregate information such as listing data, listing price, property details (bedrooms no, bathrooms no), and various other properties. 
 
The scrapers has to be scalable, and easy to configure for new sources - in this case, a source means a new public portal. 
 
The output the scraped information needs to be stored in a database. 
 
We intend to use Python as the primary programming language and MSSQL as the database warehouse."

title: Python Scraper Real Estate website
jobs_text:
"Python developers below specs: 
 
1)¬†¬†Scrape real estate data from fazwaz.com as per this URL (city=bangkok, bedrooms=2+, ownership=foreign quota):¬†¬† .  
image.png 
 
 
2) The app needs to: (a) pick up each listing detail's data on every page AND (b) loop through all the possible pages 
image.png 
 
 
3) On each listing detail's page it needs to scrape the below circled fields: 
image.png 
 
4) On each Listing Detail's page see if it has a link to "Project Name" (some details have link, and other details do NOT have links).¬†¬†If detail has link, we will go to page in next step: 
image.png 
 
5) Now we are on the "Listing Detail's" Project page, so go to "Previous Sales" section (some Project pages have Previous Sales data, other Project pages do NOT have Previous Sale data).¬†¬†If Previous Sales data is available, then scrape each of the circled fields FOR EVERY ROW.¬†¬† 
image.png 
 
6) Output the data to XLSX. 
 
 
Should be in this environment: Python 3.10, VS Code IDE, PIP package manager, and using Chrome browser. 
 
Attached is an example Python script we can use as a starting template, but we will definitely need to rewrite it. 
 
Attached is an example of the output for one Listing Detail that has five previous sales associations. 
 
***If possible I need to get this project started ASAP, so pls let me know if you have a good and reliable resource that can work on this with me.¬†¬†Estimate total time between 8-12 hours 
 
I am not a Python programmer, but I do understand about Python interpreters/virtual environments/packages, so I need help understanding how to inspect page objects to build the scraper once the project is completed."

title: Generate a CSV List From Zillow Listings that fit certain Criteria
jobs_text:
"Hey there, 
 
I'm looking for someone to scrape zillow.com to find listings that fit a certain criteria. I'm looking to see when a space is listed for rent and then later the listing is removed. It is ok if a price change has happened in between these 2 events (I have attached screenshot examples of when there is a price change between the events, and when there is not a price change between these events - see screenshot 1 and 2).  
 
I want all the home addresses where the listing has been removed within the last year (it must have the criteria of previously been listed for rent). Also if the listing was listed for sale, then the listing was removed, I do not want these to populate (See screenshot 3 for this example).  
 
So again the criteria must be 1 of 2 things. 
 
1) Listed for rent, then price change (its ok if there are multiple), then listing removed 
2) Listed for rent, then listing removed 
 
I would like to see the following addresses where this criteria fits and the listing has been removed in the last year.  
 
Many of these listings will likely have "off market" status on zillow just an fyi 
 
I am looking for a list of these addresses for the following zip codes. 33131, 33129, 33132, 33137 and 33129"
